ray.sampling

Class IndependentSampler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.sampling.IndependentSampler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SampleGenerator

    public class IndependentSampler
extends java.lang.Object
implements SampleGenerator
    A trivial implementation of SampleGenerator in which all the samples are independent and not related in any way to one another.
    Author:
    srm

      • sample

        public void sample(int row,
                   int col,
                   Point2 outPt)
        Description copied from interface: SampleGenerator
        Draw a sample from the sampling pattern. The caller explicitly decides which sample is being retrieved and which dimensions of the domain are required.
        Specified by:
        sample in interface SampleGenerator
        Parameters:
        row - Which sample of the pattern is being used; 0 <= row < SampleGenerator.getNumSamples(). Two samples drawn using the same index are not uniformly distributed (for example, they might always be the same point).
        col - Which dimensions are being used. Each distinct depth value corresponds to its own two dimensions.
        outPt - The 2D point, distributed uniformly on the unit square.

      • thread_safe_clone

        public SampleGenerator thread_safe_clone()
        Description copied from interface: SampleGenerator
        Clone this sample generator for use in an individual thread. Some sample generator might have to maintain its internal data structure, which might not be shared across multiple threads
        Specified by:
        thread_safe_clone in interface SampleGenerator
        Returns:
        a new copy of sample generator
